title: Role of Cyclins in the Cell Cycle

content.question: Based on Figure 1, which of the following describes the role of cyclin in the regulation of the cell cycle?

choices.label: During <math alttext="G 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> phase, the cyclin level decreases to signal the start of the resting phase of the cell cycle.

During <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> phase, the cyclin level peaks, resulting in an increased binding frequency with <math alttext="C D K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CDK</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

During <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> phase, the cyclin level remains the same because <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> replication is occurring.

During <math alttext="G 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math> phase, the cyclin level remains low, causing <math alttext="M P F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MPF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> activity to decrease, which leads cells to initiate mitosis.

content.answer: During <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> phase, the cyclin level peaks, resulting in an increased binding frequency with <math alttext="C D K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CDK</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
